question: ‘Five-hundred-meter Aperture Spherical Telescope (FAST)’, which was seen in the news recently, is located in which country?
explanation:
After the collapse of the historic Arecibo Observatory in Puerto Rico, China has opened the biggest radio telescope in the world to international scientists. 
The Five-hundred-meter Aperture Spherical Telescope (FAST) is located in Guizhou province of China. The construction of FAST Telescope was completed in the year 2016. Now, the telescope is being open to the doors to astronomers from across the world.
